title: a classic serif font for text
content: Our company font has been Goudy Oldstyle Std and I'm really not liking it. I was wondering if anyone had suggestions on some gorgeous serif fonts for text - for print that is??
author: elizer

comments.content: [Sabon Next](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022055431/http:/www.linotype.com/53159/sabonnext-family.html?PHPSESSID=6bd56077f7a3fee6185d5856fb5c6571) is great and now available in small, relatively inexpensive packages.

[Minion](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022055431/http:/www.paratype.com/fstore/fonts/Minion.htm)is one of my all time favorites and it looks lovely in print

[Mrs. Eaves](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022055431/http:/www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=109) is quite delightful too

Niki

As you make your selection, remember to print PDFs and examine catalogs (ask the font seller for a PDF if there is none is on the site). You can't truly test a text face on screen.
Why don't you like Goudy Old Style?

"Our company font.." is it an Airport? a Bakery? Car parts? a Dentist? Environmental solutions? Flounder sales? Gum manufacturer? Heavy Metal? How long's the text?

Cheers!

I need a good font for a retro garage sign 1930s - 1950s. I'm building and lettering a sign for a friend's barn. I plan to distress it after it's painted too. Any font ideas?
